messages: ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (10:31): hi i found bugs in mod_proxy, if i upload a .war files using the mod_proxy, im getting a 404 but its working if i use the port 8080, any solution?
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (10:32): Kuto: What file upload library are you using inside Tomcat?
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (10:33): Also, is the 404 from Tomcat or from Apache?
ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (10:36): i think its from tomcat, im uploading usng the administrative menu file.war
4a75696134c268cf1b58158c11986d95 (10:40): if its from tomcat it'd be a tomcat error page and very noticeable
4a75696134c268cf1b58158c11986d95 (10:41): http://www.acro.edu.au/public/somethingelse.jsp
ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (10:41): ok then its apache

ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (10:41): and sometimes when i clicked the administration menu, this is what i get => Tomcat's administration web application is no longer installed by default. Download and install the "admin" package to use it. "
ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (10:42): i dont see this error using port
ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (10:43): seems like the mod_proxy is not collaborating with the administration menu
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (10:46): mod_proxy really doesn't know when you're using the admin webapp or not.
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (10:46): It knows about paths.. whether to proxy it or not based on the path, but it doesn't know anything about webapps.
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (10:47): If you're getting an apache 404, that means you don't have your proxy configs set up right.
ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (10:47): check this => http://dev.thepowergames.com/TestDev
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (10:47): See the httpd.apache.org documentation page for mod_proxy.
ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (10:47): my problem is the administration
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (10:48): Okay, so install the admin package.
ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (10:48): its installed
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (10:48): Not properly installed.
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (10:49): Well, it's just your goofy installation.
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (10:49): If you had both apache and Tomcat installed correctly, and configured correctly to proxy the requests across, it would work.
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (10:49): It works on lots of peoples's machines.
ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (10:50): the proxy is working isnt it?
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (10:50): It appears so.
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (10:50): I haven't seen a 404 yet.
ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (10:51): http://dev.thepowergames.com/admin
ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (10:51): that one is
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (10:52): Kuto: You need "www.dev.thepowergames.com" in your dns.. apparently it isn't in there.
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (10:52): Kuto: And, you have your Tomcat set up to redirect to it.
ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (10:52): yeah i disabled www
ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (10:52): i only set it to work with http
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (10:53): Well, just now your site was redirecting to that, and then the browser couldn't get any DNS resolution for that.
ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (10:56): weird, i recheck my httpd.conf and its enabled by default, the www
ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (10:57): http://pastebin.com/750678
ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (11:00): how come www is down, any idea?
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (11:02): # resolveip www.dev.thepowergames.com
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (11:02): resolveip: Unable to find hostid for 'www.dev.thepowergames.com': host not found
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (11:02): [root@netninja status]# nslookup www.dev.thepowergames.com
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (11:02): ** server can't find www.dev.thepowergames.com: NXDOMAIN
ff688b70b3e61dc170c828270a5965db (11:04): apache is weird
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (11:04): Sometimes.  :)
